results.title: Lift-off at the Wackadoo Cafe
results.creator_credit: Paul Nichola, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
How do you get to the Wackadoo Cafe? All you need to do is shout “Wackadoo” and you’re there! These are 10 episodes of Wackadoo Cafe from the children’s TV series Lift off, as seen on ABC TV. Wackadoo is a crazy cafe run under the strict orders of ‘The Boss’. ‘Zelda’ the waitress weaves confidently amongst the customers, while ‘Nearly’ is nervously in charge of the drinks. ‘Cook’ a true artiste, creates works of genius in the kitchen. Regular customers are ‘Wolf’, a faded star, and the three pigs ‘Boris’, ‘Doris’ and ‘Moris’, who invariably display their mean streak. ‘Lonely’ is there too, always waiting for a friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Nichola, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Camille
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Her beauty is the stuff of Hollywood legends, her voice pure magic. Screen legend, Greta Garbo is captured at the very summit of her career. In one of the most romantic tales ever put on film, Garbo is breathtaking as the doomed courtesan whose passion for romance is equalled only by her passion for life. From her first appearance in the luxurious carriage that sweeps her off to the opera, to her last gasp in the arms of her broken hearted lover, Garbo’s performance makes an indelible impression. As Armand Duval, her ardent suitor, Robert Taylor cuts a striking figure that makes the futility of his love all the more poignant. The supporting roles are similarly cast with uncanny accuracy. Lionel Barrymore is commanding as Armand’s well-meaning father; Henry Daniell chills one’s blood with his sadistic portrayal of the Baron de Varville.

results.title: Cardio funk aerobics at the Dome with Marcus Irwin
results.creator_credit: Mark Thorn and J T V Productions
results.brief_description: Since Marcus Irwin introduced ‘Cardio Funk’ to Australia in 1989 it has become one of the most popular forms of Aerobics. Marcus and his fluorescent entourage begin this intermediate workout with a ten minute instructional segment and will guide through a routine which includes a warm up to prepare your body for the workout, a section aimed at co-ordinating, your arms and legs and gradually raises your workout level, a cardiovascular section, a ‘Jammin’ segment which combines the various steps and finally a ‘cool down’ to end your session.

results.title: Coming of age
results.brief_description: This video attempts to change attitudes to the aged and the aging process. It has been used extensively in pre and post-retirement planning programmes. Shows how older people can enjoy their lives and be fulfilled through a healthy lifestyle and a positive attitude.

results.title: It's high time to lower cholesterol
results.creator_credit: Media Cast and National Heart Foundation of Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary arising out of the 7th International Symposium on Atherosclerosis, held in Melbourne 1985. This documentary examines atherosclerosis and focuses on how it develops, how it may be acquired, and steps that can be taken to reduce the risks of heart disease. The issue of lowering cholesterol by controlling the diet, eating a balanced diet with less fatty and high cholesterol foods and more vegetables and high fibre foods is stressed. Interviews with delegates to the symposium, cardiologists and dietitians are conducted.

results.title: Five run away together. Five have a wonderful time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
In “Five run away together”, the children run away from Kirrin Cottage, when the bad Mrs. Stick, who is looking after them for a week, threatens to lock Timmy in the shed. They escape to Kirrin Island, where all is not as it should be. “Five have a wonderful time” introduces us to a snake-charmer called Miss Slither, and a fire-eater called Alfredo. While on their caravanning holiday, the children find that they must enlist the help of these new friends when they uncover a mystery at nearby Faynight’s Castle.

results.title: Die Fledermaus
results.creator_credit: Leopold Lindtberg, Richard Gregson, Humphrey Burton, Arts Intl, BBC-TV and Royal Opera House Covent Garden
results.brief_description: The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, conducted by Placido Domingo, appear in this traditional Viennese comedy - the best known and most loved operetta by the King of the waltz, Johann Strauss the younger. Sung in German, with libretto in German and English, but no subtitles. This version has Kiri Te Kanawa as Rosalinde, Hermann Prey as Eisenstein, Hildegard Heichele as Adele and Benjamin Luxon as Falke. Music is directed by Sir Colin Davis.

results.title: Euphronius painted: Krater of Heracles and Antaeus ...
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Pascal Vimenet, Delta Image, FR3, La Sept and Musée du Louvre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
The krater of Heracles and Antaeus describes a famous fight in Greek mythology. It is one of the most beautiful pieces in the Louvre Museum and is signed by Euphronius, a painter whose refined style can be found on numerous objects around 510 B.C. when a pictorial change came to pass. The program describes the krater in detail, explains Athenian ceramic techniques and something of the life of Euphronius.

results.title: I want to die at home
results.creator_credit: Monique Oomen, Vincent Burke, New Zealand Film Commission. Short Film Fund and TopShelf Productions
results.brief_description: In May 1988, Elizabeth died after a long battle with cancer of the liver. She chose to die at home, and this sensitive film documents her decision and the resources and support needed to carry out her wishes with dignity. Not only did Elizabeth decide against dying in a hospital but, in consultation with friends and family, she decided what should happen to her after death. This is not just Elizabeth’s story. It is the story of the friends and family who cared for her in dying and grieved for her in death. It is also a story - or rather the stories - of those left behind. A moving account of the elements necessary to make the choice to die at home.

results.title: It took a thief to stop a thief
results.creator_credit: Randy Grinter, Walter Shaw, Is Your Home Safe Inc and Media Productions
results.brief_description: This video covers everything from criminal attitude to locks, alarm systems, lighting, windows and position of the house. The video explores ways in which your house can be made more secure. Hosted by Walter Shaw with Eddie Egan.
